results.title: The Abyss (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: James Cameron, Gale Anne Hurd and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: An American nuclear submarine is mysteriously attacked by an unidentified vessel and when the crew of the submarine go deep into the ocean bed to investigate they find a force so powerful it threatens the future of humankind. Technically a masterpiece, with awesome set designs and special effects, and a chilling soundtrack, “The Abyss” is a terrifying movie. Directed by James Cameron (“Aliens”), “The Abyss” is an extravagantly mannerist example of the science-fiction genre in which the “dark force” is a mirror for the destructive powers which humans unleash on themselves.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James Cameron, Gale Anne Hurd and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation

results.title: The Abba story: the winner takes it all [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Chris Hunt, Steve Cole and Littlestar Services
results.brief_description: Beginning with the 1999 British production “Mamma Mia”, this fascinating documentary flashes between past and present to effectively capture the band who were phenomenally successful for 25 years and continue to capture new audiences today. Agnetha, Benny, Bjorn and Anni-Frid talk candidly (to varying degrees) to the camera, the first time they have been united since the band split up. We follow their success in the 1974 Eurovision song contest with “Waterloo”, their quick breakthrough from the one hit wonder tag to chart success in the UK and America, how they perfected their unique sound and look, the musical careers of the four prior to forming together, their marriage and separation, and their respective lives today - all interspersed with concert and recording studio footage. Interviews are conducted with fans like Bono, Tim Rice, and Australian director Stephan Elliot who attempts to explain why the band have attained a cult following with the queer audience, a somethat dubious fan- Malcolm McLaren, as well as Lasse Haalstrom who directed the band in “Abba: the movie”, following their Australian concert with a movie camera.

results.title: The 24 hour world
results.creator_credit: John Costello, Terry Hughes and London Television Service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Concorde”.
Portrays the world’s most interesting civil aircraft today - concorde - and includes some exciting shots of the aircraft in flight filmed with the R.A.F.’s Red Arrows. Sequences include: the development of civil aviation; evolution of Concorde; follow through of an actual test flight and coverage of Concord’s 1972 World Trip, via Iran, India, Singapore, Japan, to Australia

results.title: The Earthshrinker
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Concorde”.
Illustrates the advantages of the Concorde for world travel. Shows a brief history of the plane and the new technology involved.

results.title: Ten million books: an introduction to Farley Mowat
results.creator_credit: Andy Thomson, Robert Verrall and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Farley Mowat has sold more books than any other Canadian writer - ten million copies in fifty countries and in twenty-two languages. In this film Mowat recalls some of his experiences that have found their way into the pages of his books. Selected readings from such stories as The Dog Who Wouldn’t Be and People of the North bring his eloquent, subjective non-fiction to life. (An abridged version of In Search of Farley Mowat).

results.title: The Great Collaboration
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Concorde”.
Surveys the scientific and technical research that went into the English/French co-production of the supersonic jet, Concorde.

results.title: The 80 goes to Sparta
results.creator_credit: Bill Davies and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The different faces of the Greek community in Montreal in 1969, with emphasis on cultural and economic problems encountered by new immigrants. The “80” refers to the bus to “80 Av. du Pare”. Music by The Greek Stars.

results.title: The 3 worlds of Gulliver
results.creator_credit: Jack Sher, Charles H. Schneer and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Adventurer Gulliver leaves home with dreams of drama on the high seas. Tragedy strikes however in the form of a storm, washing Gulliver to the shores of Lilliput; an island inhabited by people who are just a few inches high. Gulliver quickly wins their favour and is crowned hero when he is able to wipe the Lilliputians enemy fleet. After his experiences with the little people he travels to Brobdingnag; a country inhabited by giants. Gulliver is captured by the giants as a potential toy for the Queen of Brobdingnag. Special effects are courtesy of Ray Harryhausen. Starring Kerwin Mathews, Jo Morrow and June Thorburn.

results.title: The 1940's house. Volume 2: episodes 4-5
results.creator_credit: Caroline Ross Pirie, Simon Shaw and Channel Four Television
results.brief_description: Part 2 of the Hymer’s 8 week stay in the 1940’s house. “1944-1945: the beginning of the end”: the first lot of wartime treats from the U.S turns up on the Hymer’s doorstep and is favourably received. D Day arrives and the family is treated to a picnic at the Biggins Air Show. When VE Day is upon them there’s a dance to attend with 1940’s enthusiasts. Kirstie is sent to work on aircraft and the family prepare to leave Braemar Gardens. “2001: Homecoming”: On returning from the 1940’s house, Lyn, Michael, Kirstie and the boys discuss how their lives have changed individually and as a family. We are also privy to bloopers from the show - scenes in which the family contravened the regulations laid down to them during the 8 week period. The War Cabinet provides feedback on how serious/usual their breaches were and how they think the Hymer’s fared in general. Footage of the Hymer’s visiting a refuge shelter at Chiselhurst is also shown.
